Qualifiers.scope: Regulates structures located within the buildable area of a lot along side lot lines to preserve privacy and exposure to natural light.
applicability: Applies to primary structures located within the buildable area.
Side daylight plane is measured vertically at the side lot line.
Daylight plane calculations use average grade as the reference datum.
exclusions: Structures located in the rear and/or side yards that are accessory structures are regulated by the accessory-structure daylight plane (described on the next page; not provided here).
Qualifiers.purpose: Contain development within an “invisible tent” to preserve privacy and natural light.

Variables.name: average_grade_at_wall
Variables.definition: Average grade at the relevant building wall used as the vertical datum for daylight plane measurement.
Variables.establishment_method: Established using existing grade—before any grading or fill.
sources: Notes: 'Daylight plane is measured from average grade.'
Notes: 'Average grade is established using existing grade—before any grading or fill (See Figure 44 p. 42)'.

Variables.name: existing_grade_midpoint_of_wall
Variables.definition: Existing grade elevation at the midpoint of the wall of the structure.
Variables.source: Diagram callout: 'Existing grade of the structure (at midpoint of wall)'.

Variables.name: adjacent_lot_nearest_point_grade
Variables.definition: Grade at the nearest point on the adjacent lot.
Variables.role: Potential input/reference when establishing average grade; exact usage not fully specified.
Variables.ambiguity_notes: The text does not explicitly state how this grade value is combined with other grade points to compute average grade.

Variables.name: side_lot_line
Variables.definition: The property boundary along the sides of the lot where the side daylight plane is measured up.

Variables.name: plane_base_elevation_at_side_lot_line
Variables.definition: Elevation where the daylight plane begins at the side lot line.

Variables.name: max_building_height
Variables.definition: Maximum permitted building height for the structure.
Variables.source: Referenced by callout 'Max. building height' and code cross-references (18.12.040(a) Table 2; Building Code).
Variables.ambiguity_notes: Exact numerical value not provided on this page; governed by referenced code sections and possibly the Building Code.

Constants.name: plane_slope_angle
Constants.description: Slope of the primary daylight plane inward from the side lot line.

Constants.name: vertical_offset_from_average_grade
Constants.description: Vertical distance above average grade at which the daylight plane begins at the side lot line.

Constants.name: portions_height_cap
Constants.description: A 24 ft maximum applies to certain portions of the structure; the qualifying portions are not fully legible.
Constants.source: Diagram callout '24' max. for portions [unclear remainder]'.
Constants.ambiguity_notes: The text does not specify which 'portions' are subject to the 24 ft maximum or how this interacts with the daylight plane; do not enforce without confirmation.

Constants.name: height_limit_regulated_by_building_code
Constants.description: Maximum allowed (context suggests height) is regulated by the Building Code.
Constants.source: Diagram callout 'Max. allowed is [regulated] by Building Code' [middle words unclear].
Constants.ambiguity_notes: The exact parameter under Building Code control and the precise language are not fully legible.

Conditions.text: Daylight plane is measured from average grade.
Average grade must be established using existing grade before any grading or fill.
Conditions.ambiguity_notes: The exact method/points used to compute 'average grade' are referenced to Figure 44, which is not provided here.

Conditions.text: Side daylight plane is measured vertically at the side lot line.
The primary daylight plane along side lot lines begins 10 ft above the average grade and slopes inward at 45 degrees.
Conditions.source: Diagram labels '10' from average grade' and '45°'.

Conditions.text: Compliance with the daylight plane does not waive or supersede the maximum building height; both must be satisfied.
Conditions.source: Diagram star 'Max. building height' and code cross-references.

Conditions.text: A 24 ft maximum applies to certain portions of the structure.
Conditions.ambiguity_notes: The qualifying portions and enforcement logic are not legible; hold from automated enforcement pending clarification.

Conditions.text: The phrase 'Max. allowed is [regulated] by Building Code' applies to an unspecified parameter (likely height).
Conditions.ambiguity_notes: Confirm the exact parameter regulated by the Building Code and the interaction with zoning height limits.

Exceptions.text: Accessory structures located in rear and/or side yards are not regulated by the primary daylight plane; they are regulated by the accessory-structure daylight plane (next page).

cross_references.role: General dimensional standards, including height limits that interact with daylight plane.
Related standards; exact content not provided on this page.
Related standards; exact content not provided on this page.
Definitions or general provisions; exact content not provided here.

figures_referenced.title: Front elevation showing side primary daylight plane
figures_referenced.role: Illustrates the 10 ft vertical offset and 45° slope measured at the side lot line.

figures_referenced.title: Average grade establishment (referenced)
figures_referenced.role: Defines procedure for establishing average grade; not provided on this page.

logical_dependencies: Daylight plane geometry depends on average grade established from existing (pre-fill) conditions.
Compliance requires simultaneous satisfaction of daylight plane limits and maximum building height limits; the more restrictive governs.

siblings: Accessory-structure daylight plane (not on this page)

Qualifiers.scope: Specifies the measurement location for the rear daylight plane.
applicability: Applies to rear daylight plane calculations for structures subject to rear daylight plane standards.
exclusions: Accessory structures located in rear yards may be regulated by the accessory-structure daylight plane (not provided on this page).

Variables.name: rear_setback_line
Variables.definition: The setback line at the rear of the lot from which the rear daylight plane is measured vertically.
Variables.source: Notes beneath figure: 'Rear daylight plane is measured (up) at rear setback.'

Variables.name: average_grade_at_rear_plane_reference
Variables.definition: Average grade used as the vertical datum for the rear daylight plane measurement.
Variables.establishment_method: Established using existing grade—before any grading or fill.
Variables.source: General note on average grade and reference to Figure 44 p. 42.

Conditions.text: Rear daylight plane is measured vertically at the rear setback line.
Daylight plane (including rear) is measured from average grade.

cross_references.role: Defines method for establishing average grade for measurement datum.

logical_dependencies: Rear daylight plane geometry depends on the correct identification of the rear setback line and average grade established from existing grades.

siblings: Accessory-structure daylight plane (not on this page)
